title: CryptoSlater
author: CryptoSlater
content: I think this is a good read https://cointelegraphfeed.com/?06-19-amazon-creating-token-june-23Whether you like that project or not but it should boost all the coins, I can already see some market shifting. We had a lot of rumors but now they finally pull it, what ya think?

comments.author: Doan9269
comments.body: Quote from: CryptoSlater on June 20, 2023, 11:59:41 AMWhether you like that project or not but it should boost all the coins, I can already see some market shifting. We had a lot of rumors but now they finally pull it, what ya think?How should this boost other coins, is it because it's coming from Amazon or because you have overated it ahead other coins for having maximum potentials to rise, am not underating the potential this coin could offer but always consider the risk first with altcoins before any further actions or steps on it, but am not having much conviction if this is actually coming from Amazon except an official link is being offered well stated from their official page.

comments.author: tsaroz
comments.body: Quote from: CryptoSlater on June 20, 2023, 11:59:41 AMI think this is a good read https://cointelegraphfeed.com/?06-19-amazon-creating-token-june-23Whether you like that project or not but it should boost all the coins, I can already see some market shifting. We had a lot of rumors but now they finally pull it, what ya think?This is a scam. And OP is most likely involved in it.I couldn't find any other reference for the said token and the site linked by OP "cointelegraphfeed" seems to copy cointelegraph theme but is not the real cointelegraph site.A search on original cointelegraph site doesn't yield the linked article and the formation of the article is poorer than what a real article would look like.The article about the said AMZT66 token is on the homepage of the site cointelegraphfeed and the site doesn't consist of any other pages while every other links there goes to real cointelegraph website.

comments.author: avikz
comments.body: Amazon isn't creating any tokens and they do not have a plan to step into crypto businesses. No official post from Amazon is out in the market. Also Coin Telegraph and Coin Telegraph Feed are not same. It is most likely a scam attempt so proceed with extreme caution. If Amazon ever decides to launch its own token, you will probably come to know about it from time square billboards or TV commercials.

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: This looks very much like a scam. First of all, such large-scale projects would never be launched through selling tokens on some website, and secondly, there is no information about this sale on Amazon's official website. I would refrain from any investment until a clear connection between Amazon itself and this site and their token sale is proven.

comments.author: 20kevin20
comments.body: Quote from: tsaroz on June 20, 2023, 02:41:36 PMThis is a scam. And OP is most likely involved in it.Gotta be very careful about clicking the links too. I see their article includes a link to the fake sale of the AMZ token - it’s very likely a scam or it’s trying to register your IP for whatever reasons.
